item.title: ØMQ Quiz #3
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: This quiz is based on the ZeroMQ Guide written by Pieter Hintjens. 1 What aspects of control vs data flow when designing a protocol? Show Answer Control dialogue tends to last a short time, involing few messages. The data flow could last for hours or days, involing billions of messages. Control is where “normal” errors happen e.g. not authenticated, not found, censored etc. Errors during data flow are exceptional (disk full, server crashed).

item.title: ØMQ Quiz #2
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: This quiz is based on the ZeroMQ Guide written by Pieter Hintjens. 1 Why not use ROUTER instead of PAIR sockets? Show Answer ROUTER wraps your message in an “envelope”, meaning a zero-size signal message turns into a multipart message. If you don’t care about the data and treat anything as a valid signal, and if you don’t read more than once from the socket, that won’t matter.
